Class XPathUtil

  • java.lang.Object

extends Object
    Utils class to execute XPath queries
    Author:
    Giovanni Grasso (giovannigrasso@gmail.com) Oxford University, Department of Computer Science

      • doQuery

        public static String doQuery(String expression,
                             String typeResult,
                             WebBrowser browser)
        Executes the given query and returns the textual representation of the result (not useful to retrieve nodes)
        Parameters:
        expression - the query
        typeResult - accepted values as "STRING" "BOOLEAN" "NUM" "NODESET"
        browser -
        Returns:
        the textual representation of the result (not useful to retrieve nodes)

      • count

        public static Integer count(String expression,
                            WebBrowser browser)
        Returns the value of the xpath expression count(myexpression). It throws a DiademRuntimeException if any error occurs. TODO why Integer and not int as return value?
        Parameters:
        expression - the expression to use as argument for count
        browser - the browser to use
        Returns:
        the value of the xpath expression count(myexpression), or -1 if any error occurs

      • retrieveNodePosition

        public static int retrieveNodePosition(String xpath,
                                       DOMNode target,
                                       int count)
        Gets the position of the selected DOM node by adding a positional predicate to the xpath expression. If is not found, it returns -1
        Parameters:
        xpath - the xpath expression
        node - the target DOM node
        count - the count of the OXPath expression
        Returns:
        the position

        Gets the first node returned by an xpath expression, or null if any
        Parameters:
        xpath - the OXPath expression
        node - the DOM node
        Returns:
        the first node
